# 3 seasons à 4 months 𒌗 𒌚 ⇔ 𒌓 year

𓇺 was the sign for "year" in Early Uruk (and Elam?) script 𓇺 year was ligatured with 1,2,3 strokes, similar to 𓇶𓁿 to denote year #1,2,3 or season s??

Mišil Šatti 𒁇𒈬 "middle" 𓈙 𓈗 𓇳 š.mꜣ.r ⋍ 𓈗 𓈙 𓇳 mišil ⇔ Egypt
Qīt Šatti 𒌀𒈬 "quit" 𓄿 𓆷 𓐍 𓏏 𓇳 ⋍ 𓐍 𓏏 𓇳 Qīt settle Zeit <> part

Winter

𒂗𒋼𒂗 en-te-en 𒂗𒋼𒈾 en-te-na 𒉉 enten Enden < Wendeⁿ > Winter

Šatti Zeit 𒈻 sed "cold, cool, winter" शीत śīta cold শীত śit winter cít sad содо sodo NE-Caucasian

spring

𓉐 𓂋 𓏏 𓇳 par™ ⲉⲁⲣ ἔαρ éar ear™ vs gir 𓂻 𓈝 winter-spring

Summer ⇔ Schwämmer

the names of the three natural seasons were incorporated into the Civil calendar year, but as this calendar year is a wandering year, the seasons of this calendar slowly rotate through the natural solar year, meaning that Civil season Akhet/Inundation only occasionally coincided with the Nile inundation.

The Egyptians appear to have used a purely lunar calendar prior to the establishment of the solar civil calendar[14][15] in which each month began on the morning when the waning crescent moon could no longer be seen.

𓅤 | inundated land |
